questions.question_text:
An architect has been asked about migrating a client's vRealize Automation solution from version 7.x to version 8.x. One of the requirements is to continue to support custom
XaaS (Anything as a Service) blueprints that the client has developed.
Which component of a vRealize Automation logical design will fulfill this requirement?

discussion.content: I would say C, because vRO Workflows can be made available via Content Sources

Selected Answer: A
See Infada's reference: "XaaS blueprints are migrated into two different types of VMware Cloud Templates depending on their details." If it is migrated into a cloud template, then A is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: C
Within Service Broker you can enable XaaS blueprints. 
Agreeing to frederikn.

Selected Answer: D
i choose D

questions.question_text:
An architect is designing a vRealize Log Insight cluster for an organization. The organization has the following requirements:
✑ No requirement for archival data
✑ Support a log data retention period of 14 days
How will the log data be handled in this vRealize Log Insight cluster after the 14-day retention period?

discussion.content:
For me Answer is D

In a vRealize Log Insight cluster, log data is handled based on the defined retention periods. If there’s no requirement for archival data and the log data retention period is set to 14 days, the log data will be retained in index partitions for this period.

After the 14-day retention period, the old log data will be automatically and periodically retired to free up space. This process ensures that the system can continue to store new logs while maintaining the specified retention period. This process is automatic and does not require manual intervention.

C talk about Storage Policy and its capacity.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Log-Insight/8.10/com.vmware.log-insight.administration.doc/GUID-C09BD40B-FB36-4FD8-A73C-7BB06F8835F0.html

Selected Answer: C
c OF COURSE

choices.C: Old log messages are automatically and periodically retired on a first-come-first-retired basis.
choices.A: The user needs to manually select and delete specific old log messages to free up space.
choices.D: A variable sized chunk of old log messages is deleted to free up space based on the data age basis.
choices.B: Old log messages are automatically and periodically retired on least accessed basis.
Create content source using VMware Cloud Templates option but do not configure content sharing
choices.D: Configure content sharing using All Content option
choices.E: Create content source using VMware Cloud Templates option
choices.C: Create content source using CloudFormation Template option
choices.A: Configure content sharing using Content Sources option

questions.question_text:
As a Service Broker administrator, you have been asked to meet these requirements:
✑ All released cloud templates must be imported to Service Broker.
✑ Newly released cloud templates must be automatically synchronized with Service Broker.
✑ All cloud templates must be automatically published to the service catalog.
Which two options must be configured to meet the requirements? (Choose two.)
